program main
  implicit none
  character(len=100) :: input_str
  character(len=1) :: c
  integer :: count = 0
  character(len=1), dimension(1) :: tokens

  ! Read input
  read(*, '(A)') input_str

  ! Process first program: take first character, add 1
  if (len_trim(input_str) >= 1) then
     c = char(ichar(input_str(1:1)) + 1)
  else
     c = ' '  ! handle empty input? Not sure, but the original code may crash
  end if

  ! Process second program: split into tokens (split by spaces)
  ! Since c is a single character, split by spaces will give an array with one element (c)
  tokens(1) = c

  ! Count until "0"
  count = 0
  do i = 1, size(tokens)
     count = count + 1
     if (trim(tokens(i)) == "0") exit
  end do

  ! Output the count
  print*, count

end program main
